recipes.app_iis::start_default_website: Starts the website named 'Default Web Site' if it is not already running
recipes.app_iis::update_code_svn: Retrieves code from SVN then sets up website
recipes.app_iis::update_code_s3: Retrieves code from s3 then sets up website
recipes.app_iis::msdeploy_iis_deploy: Uses an IIS Web Deploy archive to deploy code to an IIS 7 web server
recipes.app_iis::msdeploy_iis_archive: Creates an IIS Web Deploy package of the local web server
recipes.app_iis::msdeploy_sql_archive: Creates an IIS Web Deploy package from a SQL Server
Restores an IIS Web Deploy SQL package to an SQL server

long_description:
= DESCRIPTION:

Windows IIS recipes

= REQUIREMENTS:


= ATTRIBUTES: 

See metadata.rb

= USAGE:

Designed to be run within a RightScale ServerTemplate
name: app_iis

s3/application_code_package.description: The name of the application package that can be retrieved from the S3 bucket. Ex: productioncode.zip

s3/application_code_bucket.description: The S3 bucket, where the application can be retrieved. Ex: production-code-bucket

svn/force_checkout.description: A value of 'false' will attempt an svn update where 'true' will do a full checkout

svn/password.description: The SVN password that is used to checkout the application code from SVN repository.

aws/access_key_id.description: This is an Amazon credential. Log in to your AWS account at aws.amazon.com to retrieve you access identifiers. Ex: 1JHQQ4KVEVM02KVEVM02

svn/username.description: The SVN username that is used to checkout the application code from SVN repository

aws/secret_access_key.description: This is an Amazon credential. Log in to your AWS account at aws.amazon.com to retrieve your access identifiers. Ex: XVdxPgOM4auGcMlPz61IZGotpr9LzzI07tT8s2Ws

svn/repo_path.description: The URL of your SVN repository where your application code will be checked out from.  Ex: http://mysvn.net/app/

app_iis/iis_package.description: Full path to the IIS Web Deploy Package containing an IIS web server dump. For E.g. C:\myfiles\myapp.zip

app_iis/sql_package.description: Full path to the IIS Web Deploy SQL Package file. For E.g. C:\myfiles\mydata.zip

app_iis/sql_instance_name.description: SQL instance that will be used to deploy to/from using msdeploy. For E.g. .\SQLExpress or .

app_iis/database_name.description: Name of the database on an SQL that will be the source/target of an msdeploy. For E.g. app_test
